intro: Niedenzuella glabra, commonly known as the smooth niedenzuella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its simple, smooth leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical classification places it in the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots. Niedenzuella glabra is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
